en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Of a truth I know that it is so: But how can man be just with God?
hmr: “Chuong ang chu a nih ti indiktakin ka hriet a, Nisienlakhawm, mi chu iengtin am Pathien hmaa chun mi indiktak ni thei a ta?

en: If he be pleased to contend with him, He cannot answer him one of a thousand.
hmr: Ama le inkhing chu nuom ang sien khawm, Sâng khat laia pakhata khawm ama chu dawn thei naw nih.

en: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: Who hath hardened himself against him, and prospered?—
hmr: Ama chu lungrila var, hrâtnaa thilthawthei a na, Ama chunga insukngara hlawtling tu am um an ta?

en: Him that removeth the mountains, and they know it not, When he overturneth them in his anger;
hmr: Ama chun tlânghai chu a sawn a, an hriet si nawh a, An lunginsena anni a thâilet lai chun;

en: That shaketh the earth out of its place, And the pillars thereof tremble;
hmr: Hnuoi chu ama hmuna chun a sukhnîng a, Chutaka banhai khawm chu ân hnîng bawk a.

en: That commandeth the sun, and it riseth not, And sealeth up the stars;
hmr: Nisa chu thu a pêk a, a hung suok ta nawh a; Arasihai chu a khârkhip bawk a.

en: That alone stretcheth out the heavens, And treadeth upon the waves of the sea;
hmr: Ama chun vânhai chu a keiphar a; Tuisuoriet fâwnhai chungah kal a chawi a.

en: That maketh the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, And the chambers of the south;
hmr: Zângkawlawi dâm, Sîruk dâm le, Sîzucho dâm siemtu le, Simtieng kâwlkawdawng hai siemtu chu.

en: That doeth great things past finding out, Yea, marvellous things without number.
hmr: Ama chun inhmaa thil hriet suok ruollohai chu a thawh a; Anih, thilmak tiem sêng lohai chu.

en: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: He passeth on also, but I perceive him not.
hmr: En ta, ka kâwla chun a feh a, ama chu ka hmu nawh a, A fe pei a, ama chu ka hriet si nawh.

en: Behold, he seizeth the prey, who can hinder him? Who will say unto him, What doest thou?
hmr: En ta, a lâk el a, tuin am dang thei a ta? ‘Ieng am i thawh a?’ tuin am a kuomah tîng a ta?

en: God will not withdraw his anger; The helpers of Rahab do stoop under him.
hmr: “Pathien chun a lungsen chu la kîr naw nih a, Rahab ṭhangpuituhai chu a hnuoiah an kûn ngei kha.

en: How much less shall I answer him, And choose out my words to reason with him?
hmr: Kei taktê hin iengtin am ama dawn ka ta? Ama kalin khâwlai ka ieng thu tak am phawr thei ka ta?

en: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer; I would make supplication to my judge.
hmr: Kei chu mi fel ni lang khawm, la dawn naw ning a; Ka chungthu rêltu ding kuoma chun hnina siem lem ka tih.

en: If I had called, and he had answered me, Yet would I not believe that he hearkened unto my voice.
hmr: Ama ka ko chun a mi hung dawn hlak a; Ama chun ka râwl chu a ngai naw am a ni ka la sâwn rawp a.

en: For he breaketh me with a tempest, And multiplieth my wounds without cause.
hmr: Thlipui chu mîn nuoitirin, A san boin ka hliemnahai chu a sukpung tah a.

en: He will not suffer me to take my breath, But filleth me with bitterness.
hmr: Ka thuok lâk ding chu mi ngaithei naw nih a; Khâknain mi suksip lem a tih.

en: If we speak of strength, lo, he is mighty! And if of justice, Who, saith he, will summon me?
hmr: Hrâtna thu ei hril chun ama chu thilthawthei a na! Rorêlna thu hril inla, tuin am ama chu ko thei a ta?

en: Though I be righteous, mine own mouth shall condemn me: Though I be perfect, it shall prove me perverse.
hmr: Kei chu mi fel ni lang khawm ka bau ngeiin thiemnaw mîn chan a ta; Kei chu mi tluongtak ni lang khawm, kâwmâwah mîn chan a tih.

en: I am perfect; I regard not myself; I despise my life.
hmr: Mi tluongtak ka na; kei le kei kân ngaisâng nawh a; Ka hringna chu ka hmusit a;

en: It is all one; therefore I say, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
hmr: A rêngin angkhat vawng a nih; chu lei chun annâwm, ‘Ama chun mi tluong le mi khawhlo khawm chu a suksiet ve ve,’ ka ti chu.

en: If the scourge slay suddenly, He will mock at the trial of the innocent.
hmr: Vuokna chun a sukhlum nghâl chun, Mi pawitâwklo vângduoina chu nuisan a tih.

en: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked; He covereth the faces of the judges thereof: If it be not he, who then is it?
hmr: Hnuoi hi mi khawhlo kuta chun pêk a na, Chu chun rorêltuhai hmaihai chu ama chun ân khum a nih. Ama a ni naw chun, tu am nîng a ta?

en: Now my days are swifter than a post: They flee away, they see no good.
hmr: “Tuhin ka nihai chu thangkohai nêkin an hrât lem a; An tlân hmang a, thil ṭha hrim an hmu nawh.

en: They are passed away as the swift ships; As the eagle that swoopeth on the prey.
hmr: Lawnglien hrâthai angin an fe hmang a; Mupui a sa fâk ding chunga a bir ang elin.

en: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad countenance, and be of good cheer;
hmr: ‘Ka sawisêlna theinghil ka ta, Ka hmêl lungngai hi sie hmang ka ta, Hlimtakin um ka tih,’ ti lang:

en: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.
hmr: Ka lungngainahai po po chu ka ṭih a, Nang chun pawitâwkloah mi sie naw ti ni ti ka hriet sih a.

en: I shall be condemned; Why then do I labor in vain?
hmr: Thiemnaw inchangtirin um ngei ka tih; Chuong sa chun, a thlâwn elin ienga dîm lân rim rawp ka ta?

en: If I wash myself with snow water, And make my hands never so clean;
hmr: Vûrtuiin kei chu insilin, Ka kuthai chu changalin sâwp lang khawm,

en: Yet wilt thou plunge me in the ditch, And mine own clothes shall abhor me.
hmr: Nang chun khura chun mi phûm tho i ta, Ka silfênhai ngei chun mi tirdak an tih.

en: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, That we should come together in judgment.
hmr: Ama chu ka dawn dingin keima anga mihriem a ni si nawh a, Rorêlnaa hang ngîr hmunkhatpui ding êm chun.

en: There is no umpire betwixt us, That might lay his hand upon us both.
hmr: Kan inkârah ṭheltu tukhawm an um nawh a: Kan chunga kut innghat ve ve theitu ding chu.

en: Let him take his rod away from me, And let not his terror make me afraid:
hmr: Keimaa inthawkin a hmawl chu la hmang sienla, A ṭiumnahai chun mi sukṭi ta naw raw se,

en: Then would I speak, and not fear him; For I am not so in myself.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama ṭi loin thu hril ka tih. Keimaa hin chuong ang chu ka ni si nawh a.
